docs.snippet: Disgraced Uruguay striker Luis Suarez, who is serving a four-month ban for a biting incident at the World Cup, could make his Barcelona debut against Real Madrid in El Clasico in October.
docs.lead_paragraph: Disgraced Uruguay striker Luis Suarez, who is serving a four-month ban for a biting incident at the World Cup, could make his Barcelona debut against Real Madrid in El Clasico in October.

headline.main: Banned Suarez Could Make Barca Debut in El Clasico
headline.print_headline: Banned Suarez Could Make Barca Debut in El Clasico

docs.snippet: Paraguayan yerba mate producers say Uruguay's president is thirsty for more of the traditional tea for his country and is asking them to fill the need at a lower price.
docs.lead_paragraph: Paraguayan yerba mate producers say Uruguay's president is thirsty for more of the traditional tea for his country and is asking them to fill the need at a lower price.

headline.main: Uruguay Leader Thirsty for Paraguay's Yerba Mate
headline.print_headline: Uruguay Leader Thirsty for Paraguay's Yerba Mate

docs.snippet: Coach Jorge Luis Pinto has decided to quit World Cup quarter-finalists Costa Rica because they refused to allow him to choose his backroom staff.       "I realised I would not be able to count on conditions to carry out my work," the 61-year-old...
docs.lead_paragraph: Coach Jorge Luis Pinto has decided to quit World Cup quarter-finalists Costa Rica because they refused to allow him to choose his backroom staff.       "I realised I would not be able to count on conditions to carry out my work," the 61-year-old Colombian said on his personal website (www.jorgeluispinto.com) on Thursday.

headline.main: Pinto Quits Costa Rica After 'Sleeping With Enemy'
headline.print_headline: Pinto Quits Costa Rica After 'Sleeping With Enemy'

docs.snippet: Barcelona are looking to recapture the kind of form they hit when former coach Pep Guardiola, the club's most successful manager, took over in 2008, midfielder Andres Iniesta said on Friday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Barcelona are looking to recapture the kind of form they hit when former coach Pep Guardiola, the club's most successful manager, took over in 2008, midfielder Andres Iniesta said on Friday.

headline.main: Barca Need to Play Like They Did in 2008, Iniesta Says
headline.print_headline: Barca Need to Play Like They Did in 2008, Iniesta Says

docs.snippet: Top-seeded Fabio Fognini rallied to defeat Borna Coric of Croatia 5-7, 7-6 (4), 6-3 in the quarterfinals of the Croatia Open on Friday.

docs.snippet: Jorge Luis Pinto, who produced the surprise of the World Cup by coaching tiny Costa Rica to the quarterfinals, is leaving the team.

headline.main: Pinto Leaves Costa Rica After Failing to Agree to Contract
headline.print_headline: Pinto leaves Costa Rica; fails to agree contract

docs.snippet: Luxury hotels usually have formal restaurants to match their elegant ambience, but some high-end properties are creating more relaxed and casual dining options for their guests.

docs.snippet: Heavy rain washed out the Croatia Open semifinals on Saturday.

docs.snippet: Liverpool have pulled out of signing France international striker Loic Remy from promoted Queens Park Rangers, according to media reports in England and the United States where Liverpool are on tour.

docs.snippet: Real Madrid, which won the Champions League final but finished only third in La Liga, reacted by shelling out more than $150 million to buy three outstanding players.
